doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/HD HYUNDAI MIPO Merger with HHI to serve as value unlocking towards naval business raise PT to W270KHD HYUNDAI MIPO Merg_2025-08-31

passages.text: Merger with HHI to serve value unlocking towards naval business; raise RT to W270K

We raise our Dec- 26 PT for Hyundai Mipo (Mipo) to W270K (from W250K). HD Heavy Group announced it will merge HHI with Mipo, allowing the Mipo docks to be used for US navy fleet production (with HHI's license). The company will also transition 2 docks out of 4 for naval fleet construction use, which could add 6 additional navy fleet annual capacity, tapping into the global navy market (link to report). Mipo was considered to have relatively less navy exposure compared to HHI/KSOE and Hanwha Ocean, but with the merger, we expect to see positive share price momentum from ample navy related catalysts ahead. Moreover, with the merger ratio set at 1:0.4 (HHI:Mipo), we think positive navy business development at HHI should also lead to similar price movement for Mipo, with potential market arbitrage trade between the two stocks. After a shareholders' meeting to approve the merger on \(23^{\text{rd}}\) October, the effective date of merger will be on \(1^{\text{st}}\) December. With Mipo's new exposure to the navy business, we raise our target price orderbook multiple to 0.6x (from 0.5x) and raise our PT accordingly to W270K. Maintain OW.
Table 1: HHI and Mipo merger details

Note: For HHI, downside risks to our price-to-orderbook multiple based price target include: 1) Korean builders being required to build US navy ships in the US, leading to margin concerns; 2) HHI share price volatility affecting arbitrage trades. Source: Company data, J.P. Morgan, Bloomberg Finance L.P.

Orders are well on track despite the slow new order trend in 1H amid global uncertainties. We highlight strong orders in LNG BVs, and we expect Mipo to receive more throughout the year. Mipo has already digested its low- margin 2021 orders and is shifting its mix to higher- margin ships, which we expect to continue in the next 2- 3 years. In 2026E, when Mipo starts delivering 2024 orders, we expect OPM to reach near the \(10\%\) level, which could still prove to be conservative as the vessel price is near previous peak levels when it delivered high- teens OPM. Additionally, we see further upside to earnings when strong LNG BV orders from end- 2024 start to contribute to margin expansion, which we expect to be 2026E.
Our Dec- 26 PT of W270k is based on a target multiple of 0.6x 12m forward order backlog, reflecting a mid- cycle industry environment.

Orders are well on track despite the slow new order trend in 1H amid global uncertainties. We highlight strong orders in LNG BVs, and we expect Mipo to receive more throughout the year. Mipo has already digested its low- margin 2021 orders and is shifting its mix to higher- margin ships, which we expect to continue in the next 2- 3 years. In 2026E, when Mipo starts delivering 2024 orders, we expect OPM to reach near the \(10\%\) level, which could still prove to be conservative as the vessel price is near previous peak levels when it delivered high- teens OPM. Additionally, we see further upside to earnings when strong LNG BV orders from end- 2024 start to contribute to margin expansion, which we expect to be 2026E.
Our Dec- 26 PT of W270k is based on a target multiple of \(0.6x12m\) forward order backlog, reflecting a mid- cycle industry environment.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe.
